definition: to deal the fatal blow (sports, chess etc)/to score the winning point
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: Maybe I let you to believe it was easy when it wasn't.
sentences.chinese: 也许我让你觉得我投出去的每一个球都是绝杀。

sentences.english: The USA topped the group after an injury-time winner over Algeria.
sentences.chinese: 美国绝杀阿尔及利亚，获得了小组头名。

sentences.english: The goal will make it into every Champions League trailer.
sentences.chinese: 这粒绝杀将会入选每次欧冠联赛的集锦。

sentences.english: 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed.
sentences.chinese: 26次投丢被委以信任的绝杀一球。

sentences.english: Neville was accused of goading City supporters after Michael Owen's dramatic injury-time winner at Old Trafford.
sentences.chinese: 内维尔被指控在欧文绝杀之后挑衅曼城球迷。

sentences.english: But it was the sharp-shooting of Owen that grabs the headlines and left Fletcher in awe.
sentences.chinese: 但欧文的绝杀让弗莱彻上不了头版了。

definition: to turn back/to reverse
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
end (of a performance or sports match)/last round of testing in the imperial examinations
(sports) overtime/extra time/play-off
to breach/to invade
to score a goal/goal (sport)
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
(sports) overtime/extra time/play-off
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
to beat easily/to gain an easy victory
(sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages)/(abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time
free kick
own goal (ball sports)
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
